channel.title: The Golden Days
channel.description:
I miss the days of moparscape and silabsoft. When you didn't need to download a client for every new server you played. When you trained on doors and attack dummies. When SyiPkers were the big scare and hardly anyone knew how to how to dupe. Those were the golden days of RSPS. A person would post their server on the Status page and instantly get 10-20 players without even trying. It would be a very good thing just to stay above 90% uptime.
Now, there's all these dedicated servers, vps hosting, servers making thousands of dollars. The fun has been sucked out of private servers and it has basically become a business. What made RSPS fun was the fact that the servers were so much easier than rs and everything was so simple. Now, the new servers try to be so much like runescape. I think I would rather play the real Rs then some look alike that could never amount to the real thing.
Just a small rant... agree, disagree, it doesn't really matter. I for one have done my best to bring back the old.
Thanks for Reading
This was by mr dope This topic was accually nice to read because it brings back moments for old rsps players Plus the idea to make money from people on rsps is dumb the owners can get a job and work for a living not make money from players who have almost no money from donating to them When people donate you know your just giving your money away to some guy who cant make his own and gives you a cool simbal and later on when you have like 100b shuts down the server so whats the point of donating mr dope is right he did has been trying to keep it old he accually hosts a allstarscape source what is currently down atm soon to be back up dont judge him he accually is a nice guy who does know how to code he accually has one of the best allstar anti nullers and anti duper atm :p he also has added alot of stuff since his last release i'm saying this because im one of his veteran's i bet he is smarter than alot of you first because he doesnt troll like alot of mopar players and he is accually in collage atm and has been coding for along time!
Thanks :p

item.title: The Golden Days
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

SilentCJ:

I don’t understand the people who actually pay to play on the servers, or donate to them, where do these kiddies get the money and have they nothing better to spend it on? Runescape membership is enough for me, or am I just a stingy git?

I don’t even pay for RS membership, so know, I don’t think your stingy

Read full topic

item.title: The Golden Days
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

casey.:

i miss casey as a mod

[quote=“Chassy13, post:26, topic:415308”][quote author=jme link=topic=517268.msg3757946#msg3757946 date=1316638271]
What can be done about it though, we offer thousands of dollars for people to make private server stuff and no one’s even interested =/
[/quote]

Not many people here have the knowledge or time to create something efficient. If I am correct, only a couple or a few people have been paid for this reason right?

The only direction I see the money going is in MITB’s pocket, I have not seen it used in any other way. I don’t like the idea of sponsored servers in communities that promote the development of RSPS. Who wants to develop a serious server that will take days to program when the maximum players you’re going to get is 5-20, even when you’re paying for a VPS?

I’ve seen the accepted bids and the kind of money that comes in each month for voting. No one can try and tell me there wouldn’t be enough money to pay for dozens of people if they developed efficient servers.[/quote]The only people capable of completing such a project is a team that is willing to work together. I’ve watched a few groups attempt at the offer MITB has had up for the past few years and every time it ends horribly.

I admit, I’m not the best programmer in town, let alone relevant at all to what is made on this forum now-a-days. But if there were ever a serious team, I would love to be part of it. Even if that meant having the lowest position possible. This forum is about development and cooperation.

Read full topic

What can be done about it though, we offer thousands of dollars for people to make private server stuff and no one’s even interested =/

Not many people here have the knowledge or time to create something efficient. If I am correct, only a couple or a few people have been paid for this reason right?

The only direction I see the money going is in MITB’s pocket, I have not seen it used in any other way. I don’t like the idea of sponsored servers in communities that promote the development of RSPS. Who wants to develop a serious server that will take days to program when the maximum players you’re going to get is 5-20, even when you’re paying for a VPS?

I’ve seen the accepted bids and the kind of money that comes in each month for voting. No one can try and tell me there wouldn’t be enough money to pay for dozens of people if they developed efficient servers.

item.title: The Golden Days
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:21, topic:415308”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=517268.msg3757828#msg3757828 date=1316631799]

Oh… I thought the golden days were before the silabsoft client, and before SYIPkPker. When the entire server was based around Varrock east bank and the dummies across the street. When there were no money making skills, you just ran to pick up a cash pile and run back to buy armor. Pk, wash, rinse, repeat.

Careful buddy! Your starting to sound like Lin!

Haha just kidding, I agree 100 percent that those were the best days for me personally. But we have to take into account that we were so much younger and it was all new to us. The server developers were also very young as well. As the server developers grew older they saw that their servers could make money and thats what ruined it for us all. I remember the first private server to ever be hosted on a vps people were dumbfounded that it could be up /infinitely/ without any downtime.

I wouldn’t mind making an old school server though mdog. Maybe you and I could start something and not give up for once?

Wouldn’t be a bad idea. Only lets not do a Lin and add things that were never in the old school servers, which is where his project kinda died off And the first VPS server would have been Dodian, correct? Always hated that server actually
[/quote]

Dodian was what, late 2007? The first one I remember ever playing on that had a VPS was… pkisle of course. Bezza was about 17 or 18 back then and he was already in it for the money. He may well have been the first person to ever ask for donations other then RS Gold.[/quote]
I actually found Moparscape through Dodian, in mid-late 06. It might not have been nearly as big back then, can’t remember.

Read full topic

item.title: The Golden Days
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

Reminds me of a server called “Combattscape”. It was my first RsPs. I was playing it about 8 months and then someone teached me how to dupe, I duped 24-7 :D. Then a Co-owner got hacked and gave 3 ppl mod (include me) to ban everyone that comes online and he also gave his Perfect rings, Witch I duped and gave to a dubbel account. Then when we got demoted and everything was fine I still had the Perfect rings with me. Few days after server went down…

Good times

Read full topic
